website_summaries.verdict: While they might spend most of the day sleeping, cats do get bored during those long afternoons without you. The Kitty Sill solves the problem. It's a comfortable lounging spot that's perfect for catnaps, and it also serves as an observation deck on life outside the window.
pros: Cats love to perch and sleep way up high, so they'll instinctively be drawn to the Kitty Sill
Strong Velcro holds the perch in place on your window sill, or use the included screws for permanent attachment
The comfy bed has a soft bolster around the back and is padded with extra-soft micro-fleece to keep Fluffy cozy
cons: Your window sill must be at least two inches deep to support this cat bed

website_summaries.verdict: Every spoiled princess or pampered prince deserves a throne, and this luxurious perch delivers just that. Ideal for comfort-loving kitties or older cats in need of extra padding.
pros: Features a standout design with plush orthopaedic cushioning, a soft security bolster, and ornate legs
Can easily be clipped onto any windowsill or screwed into place as a permanent fixture
Removable cover is washing machine safe
Bolster can be removed for cats who prefer not to be boxed in
cons: Requires at least 2 inches of windowsill for secure installation

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I ever made for my cat!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my cat was always sitting on top of my desk while I was trying to work so she can see out the window. Since we bought this, she stays off my desk and on the Perch. She mostly uses it to spy out the window, but as you can see from the photo she likes to nap on it too :-) Came Quickly and Easy to Assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Love the kitty sill!! Carlos gives it 5 claws!
customer_reviews.text: The Kitty Sill came today! The shipping was fast and it was a breeze to install. As you can see from one of the pictures I posted, I have a small sill, but it was plenty for the screws to grab onto. Carlos is in heaven! For those that wonder about the weight, he is 16.5 lbs. Carlos and myself are very please with the kitty sill!
customer_reviews.author: mzwelch2007

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a few days now & my cat absolutely loves it! I got it because the house I was moving to has higher windows. She loves watching the birds & relaxing on it. Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Spevak

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bed, nice large size
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful bed, nice large size, and easy to install. I have 2 kittens (one is 10 lbs, one is 8-1/2 lbs) and they love it. They can both fit on it at the same time, or stretched out one at a time. I used the screws in my sill for extra support.
customer_reviews.author: S. Y. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Makes me worry
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to assemble. It works fine as well, I am concerned about my cat getting bigger and it may not hold but it did come with screws if you don't want to use the velcrow strips. The legs are plastic and I feel they won't hold but we shall see. Not gunna lie though I wish it looked better kinda looks tacky XD
customer_reviews.author: Tea_Vomit

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: my cats absolutely adore these window seats! we had one in our apartment that we bought about 3 years ago. it was amazing and the cats love it so much, we bought 2 more when we bought a house! easy to install ( 3 screws into window sill) and the cover comes off to wash when needed.
customer_reviews.author: samanthadorito

customer_reviews.title: Velcro does not hold 20lb Cat
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this purchase. I have a large cat and it seems like everything I've ordered or found in store doesn't fit his fat butt, except this! I initially used the velcro, which seemed heavy duty but I noticed it sliding after the 2nd day, so I used the screws and mounted it to my window sill. I also turned the fabric around so the sleeve prevents fatty from falling off. He's in this thing everyday, for hours at a time. I know he's happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Monsta Dee

customer_reviews.title: SO HAPPY WITH THESE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just put two of these up today and I could not be happier!!! I used the velcro and based on a review I read I decided to also use two large Command velcro strips and it works great! The tiger cat in the pictures is 19 lbs and the perch didn’t budge! Love, love, love!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Lee

customer_reviews.title: So mad! Get it together amazon!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this negative stars I would. I received A extremely damaged open box with no screws or Velcro or directions. After about 10 to 15 minutes of me trying to work it out by myself I looked up the directions and found out that I had a bunch of missing pieces. My poor cat is sniffing the Window perch because he wants to get on it but I can’t even put it together. I am extremely upset. I also purchased a new product not a used one. So don’t really understand why I received a used package.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekka Glover

customer_reviews.title: Great kitty bed for the Price. Just takes a cheap alteration for SAFE installation.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bed since we are renters, despite the known issues with the Velcro and/or screw option for installation. Use an entire pack of the large Velcro-style Command Strips (no joke, use all four) and you will have one sturdy cat perch. I knocked a star off my overall score just for this extra step, but it is well worth it. They boys love it and regularly take turns with the one we bought, so we're expecting to buy another, plus a pack of Command Strips, in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Homebody

customer_reviews.title: A big hit
customer_reviews.text: Daisy loves her perch. She suns herself, sleeps and keeps a close watch on the courtyard and the birds that visit. She is a rescue and before I think she was bored. I recently moved into a senior living home. The windows are too high for her to see outside. She was eyeing my houseplants which are strictly off-limits for her. This perch was very easy to install. I did not want one that used suction cups which I have had lousy luck with and I wanted to be able to lower the shade. This fits the bill. I just needed to put her in it once and she owned it.
customer_reviews.author: Spinner

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this negative stars I would! The velcro and screws used to attach the unit, so it is safe to use, are both missing. I don't have time to ship it back and order another one. My cat is dying, and I wanted him to be able to enjoy looking out the window during his last few days (without risk of falling off the sill). The nearest fabric store is an 80 mile round trip. I can scrounge up some screws so I can attach it, but I didn't want to drill holes - I wanted to use the velcro, so it didn't damage the original 110+ year old wood window frames. VERY UNHAPPY!
customer_reviews.author: Suze

customer_reviews.title: My cats absolutely love this!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE this window perch. The window perch comes with two installation methods, screws or a sort of command strip system. I used the command strips after wiping down my window sill. My 20 pound cat and my 13 pound cat have both spent time on this window ledge and it has held up just find. The adjustable legs are an awesome feature--other window sill cat seats haven't worked for my 1930s home's windows, but with adjustable legs this one is perfect. I plan to buy another as both cats are vying for the same spot! My cats don't like cat towers or cat toys, but this product they LOVE.
customer_reviews.author: MoundCity

customer_reviews.title: My cat loved it. I came home this past Saturday and ...
customer_reviews.text: got this at the end of Dec. My cat loved it. I came home this past Saturday and the perch was on the floor. All of the plastic tabs were broken off and couldn't be reattached. My cat does not weigh 40lbs, so that wasn't the problem. He wasn't jumping up on it from the floor. I had a chair next to it so it was just a short step over to the perch.
customer_reviews.author: sandra willis

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my previous window perch. Very easy to put up. I definitely recommend using the screws. I don't think that the Velcro alone will hold it. I like the cushioned, supported base. My other one was just a soft cover which led to major drooping. I have a 12 LB cat and a 6 LB cat. When they're in a good mood they both sit on it together.
customer_reviews.author: Asiangrrl

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: fits well in our bonus room and kitty loves it. The velcro doesn't seem to last or gives way especially since the sun is on it during the day. Didn't want to but will have to screw this perch into the windowsill. Still giving 5 stars though because we and kitty are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not even a refund cause I’d really like this for my cat
customer_reviews.text: It did not come with any of the accessories to actually put it up. No tape no screws nothing. I ordered another one and that one came with no accessories either. So I have TWO boxes sitting in my house that are unusable. I emailed the manufacturer to ask just for the accessories. Not even a refund cause I’d really like this for my cat. They never replied. That was in January. Completly wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: RedLyght

customer_reviews.title: He won't sit anywhere else now...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, nice looking, made with good quality materials. My cat loves it. I know exactly where to find him now!
customer_reviews.author: Cherish Fox

customer_reviews.title: my cat is comfy now!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this!!! She used to look so uncomfortable staring out the window but now she is comfy!! Easy install! Glad i read the reviews to click in bottom part and use the screws. I would recommend this window seat to anyone with a cat!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to put together and it seems very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I bought this for my rabbit because he was trying to see out the window but couldn't. It was very easy to put together and it seems very sturdy, though, to be fair my rabbit only weighs around 5 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Morris

customer_reviews.title: useless without screwing it to the windowsill
customer_reviews.text: The brackets snapped in place easily. The velcro strips were easy to use. Unfortunately that is all the good news. I followed the directlons exactly and actually barricaded the area so my cats wouldn't get on the perch before the glue on the velcro strips could set. Next day, I allowed them to try it out. Within hours, it came crashing to the floor. I tried it again, but the same thing happened. If you are willing to screw the perch into the windowsill, it would be great, but I had no intention of doing that. If velcro strips are provided as an alternative, they should be stong enough to hold. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: gatorfan

customer_reviews.title: Sherlock loves his new home!
customer_reviews.text: A picture is worth a thousand words! Sherlock decided he loved his new bed only a few hours after I installed it. He is 17 years old, 10.5 lbs and has no trouble jumping into it. He feels secure and safe. The item arrived when expected, in great shape with all the proper hardware. Took 15 minutes to put up with screws - didn't want to fool around with Velcro. Appears to be well made and aesthetically pleasing in our living room window. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Butler

customer_reviews.title: Great high quality perch and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: "Kitten" LOVES his new perch. I installed it on a super windy day, so it was a perfect day for kitty TV... and he's hooked! I had new window inserts I stalled this fall, so my sils are narrow, I wasn't sure how well it would work, but so far it's holding great with just the velcro. Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thor the horse

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE these and fight over who gets to lay on it! It’s so easy to assemble, TRUST me (I can’t assemble anything). The cover comes off to wash which is great and a must, but when you screw the seat to the window sill like we did, it makes it hard to cover the back completely and it rides up, causing the cover to come off with the help of my cats. And when they tear it off, the beautiful brats rip up the foam, which isn’t the fault of the company, but still thought I’d note. Great price as well! I need to order a third! Holds plenty of weight!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as it looks...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little perch when I saw it and read the reviews! It was tough to get it to fit my window sill and one of the plastic pieces on the legs broke off while I was trying to rearrange it to fit. Once I had the Velcro installed and let it sit overnight, I thought for sure my boy would be able to sit and enjoy his birdies, but, unfortunately, the Velcro, nor the legs held up.more than a few "lounging" times. I can't use the screw because I'm in a rental. I did go purchase double-sided tape to try and remedy the problem, but he is a bit large (tubby) and that didn't last either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Collapsed onto my cat
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cat when we moved into a new home and no ledges were big enough to lounge on. I set this up according to the instructions, using the velcro tape, on a surface compatible with the adhesive. In about a week, the adhesive completely came undone. My cat only weighs about 9lbs. She was sitting underneath this (yes, the adhesive gave out without her even being on it), it fell onto her, and now she's absolutely terrified of it in addition to still adjusting to a new home. Thank you for making this even more difficult for her.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Graf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Window Seat!
customer_reviews.text: I love it almost as much as my cat! Perfect for her to look out the window without having the oversized cat tower that we used to have!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Moose cat LOVES his Kitty sill!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this sill for Moose for Christmas 2018 and it took a little while for him to reliaze it was for him and how amazing it is. Now he is always lounging in the sunshine, taking cat naps, hiding from the toddler and spying on the birds and neighbors on his comfy little perch! I also contacted customer service about a general question and they were very helpful and went above and beyond to help me out! I very highly reccomend you purchase this Window Sill bed for your cat, you won't regret it. I installed it myself easily, with no help from my husband, so anybody can do it! Don't hesitate, make your cat happy today! Do it!
customer_reviews.author: Coral Henney

customer_reviews.title: Product is good, just wish my cats would use it...
customer_reviews.text: Installation was simple. Unlike some other reviewers, I used only the velcro to attach the mount to my windowsill and disregarded the screws that came included. It’s been up for about two months without issue. It will hold both of my cats... if they ever decided to actually use it!
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: New Favorite Spot
customer_reviews.text: To the point: Very easy to assemble, sturdy, and aesthetically unobtrusive. My cat’s most favorite activity in the world is sitting at the glass front storm door watching the world go by. With winter coming, we needed an alternative as the front door will be closed. This seat assembled in less than 30 seconds. It came with adhesive strips or screws to attach to the sill, but I opted for Command Velcro strips (4) and it worked perfectly. Very safe and sturdy. No movement when my cats jump up and down. The fleece is fluffy and cozy. Vacuums easily. Looks nice, doesn’t clash with my decor. For reference, my cats are 9 lbs. and 12 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: L. Potter

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!!!! 😻😻
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old torti cat loves her window perch, so much that I bought her another one for downstairs!!! After trying it in a few different windows, she decided her favorite is an East facing window so she can bask in the morning sun. Since she isn’t a very large cat, the provided Velcro strips do the job just fine. For a bigger cat, I would recommend using the included screw anchors to ensure it won’t budge. The Velcro strips can be purchased anywhere and can be used with this perch, so if I need to relocate it, it’s easy, just pull it off and adhere to a different window sill!!!! Excellent purchase and cat approved!! 😻👌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Brynn Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Took all of 24 hours to fall off the window.
customer_reviews.text: Probably had my cat on it at the time, which would have been hilarious to see, but still pretty disappointing. It comes with a velcro/adhesive attachment, and a screw-in attachment. The adhesive attachment is just plain bad. I'm sure this would work better if you screw it in, but my window sills are marble so that wasn't an option. Also, the build quality just boggled my mind how it would even cost this much... But I wouldn't have cared if it at least worked. I recommend looking into building one yourself for a fraction of the price. That should be easy enough and much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hyperion

customer_reviews.title: Cat lives on it. Won't go anywhere else.
customer_reviews.text: I have spent hundreds, possibly thousands, of dollars trying to please this freaking animal. He has snubbed every single toy, scratcher, or cat tree I have ever purchased. He now lives on the window sill. He literally spends 10+ hours a day on this thing. It's in my office-from the moment I clock in at 8am to well after I get off work, he will be sprawled out behind me on his new favorite seat. Make sure you use the screws, not the Velcro. It's not strong enough and eventually kitty and window seat will topple to the ground and kitty will give you increasingly mean looks until it is properly fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Palermo

customer_reviews.title: Cat LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift for my parents and their cat absolutely loves it. My dad used screws to attach to the wall. The first 24 hours of having it on the window the cat laid there literally all day looking out the window. The fabric is adorable and it's a very nice size. The quality exceeded my expectations. Can't think of anything negative to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My 11 lb. dog absolutely loves this! I would highly recommend using the screws enclosed. I don't think that the Velcro strips would hold any weight at all. It took about 2 minutes to assemble it. The cats enjoy this too. My 20 lb. cat fits on the shelf with the dog easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Black

customer_reviews.title: Trying to figure out how I can modify this.
customer_reviews.text: I work with an animal rescue and foster several cats at a time with them. I was hoping I would not have to drill holes in my window sills since many of the best windows are adjacent to passages. A;lso with these sliding windows, the cat shelf will interfere with the opening of the windows. These might work well with double-hung windows. I have a "cat room" that has a lovely long shelf under the windows, but not much sun. All of my south-facing windows are the sliding type. I've decided to try to install the shelf on one of these three window sills. It will be crowded with nine cats trying to catch some sun there.
customer_reviews.author: Spud's PlaceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A kitty injury waiting to happen...
customer_reviews.text: I DO NOT RECOMMEND. PLEASE, do NOT purchase one of these unless you plan on screwing it into your wall. I bought 2 sills and installed them using the velcro tape that came with the sills. The velcro failed on BOTH kitty sills! My cat was on one when it happened, too. Thankfully, she was not injured. I contacted K&H Pet Products to return the sills for a refund and they said that the would not refund me for the 2 sills, but could send replacement velcro. Why would I use the velcro again if it failed on BOTH SILLS? I am really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BArnold

customer_reviews.title: Nice, sturdy window perch
customer_reviews.text: Really like this. Its very sturdy, one of my cats is kind of chubby... And it holds him very well. I had to use longer screws to screw it into my window sill but no biggie. Make sure you wrap the top cover around the side your going to screw into window sill BEFORE you screw it in! Otherwise you wont be able to fit it on that side. And make sure you leave a little room between the plastic and sill to put the cover on. I might also puy a thin blanket on it for a little more cushion. But thats probably more for me than it is my cats. I dont think they care.
customer_reviews.author: Rhi Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: My 3 cats are always trying to get up to this window and fight over the cat tree we have in from of a different window. I decided to buy this so they had more window spaces. It was extremely easy to install. First we installed it with the tape/velcro. However we started to get nervous because we noticed it bending a little. We then installed it using the screws which was way better. All three cats use this and love it. The padding is self warming which is always a win in our michigan house. Also, the padding is washable which I was happy about. I would definitely buy one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: 4 paws up from Rusty & Smokey
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love this, easy to install. I screwed it into the window because I have Fatty McFat sitting on it. #2 - I have bought a 2nd one for another room. My kitties love it and sometimes they both sit on it at the same time, which is over 30lbs of cat. If you have a big cat get this, it does not mark up the wall but you need to screw it into the sill. If you rent, get it anyway and sparkle it up when you leave! These are the 2 fatties who sit on it but don't have a pic of them on the seat.
customer_reviews.author: DMSN1220Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: This provided a very nice window sleeping-viewing platform for the cats. Its used everyday and also provides a spot where its easy to pay attention to them, eg; off the floor. Its invasive and requires hard connection to the window sill and wall with a few screws. Great product. The pseudo sheepskin needs to be seasoned with a familiar scent so the cats don't avoid it. We rinsed it out, let it air dry and rubbed it all over their normal sleeping spots. Otherwise they seemed to avoid it. Now its part of their daily routine.
customer_reviews.author: Quaoptic

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Loves this Sturdy, Stable Hammock!
customer_reviews.text: Our kitty has never loved a hammock/perch like he does this one! We have been failed by suction cup hammocks over the years. Guilt follows when a suction failure causes the hammock to dump a snoozing cat, and it is understandable that the cat initially viewed this hammock with suspicion. Happily, he now trusts that this improved model is secure, and he can doze while viewing wildlife in perfect comfort. The hammock is firmly attached by screws which come with it. I like that the cover can zip off to be washed, and it's sturdy enough for two kitties if they feel inclined to share.
customer_reviews.author: FlamNgoil

customer_reviews.title: My cats favorite Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to our cat George for Christmas and he loves it. He's been sleeping up there, looking out the window, surveying his kingdom. I was a little worried it wouldn't support him as he's a big cat (tall and close to 20lbs) but the velcro seems to be holding up well. The only thing I added was a hand towel under the cover as I felt he needed a little more cushion, but overall this was a great purchase, and I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: NYMOM2001

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro released from the plastic underside the very first time my small cat stepped on it and I did indeed wait the 24 hrs for it to set, scared the cat and she refuses to come near the thing even though I mounted it on a small table and pushed it up to the window. Flushed that money down the toilet. Don’t buy if you can’t mount with screws. I have marble window sills and cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K. Nickels

customer_reviews.title: love it, exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if it was going to stay put and I couldn't figure out why it would but the tape really holds it in place (make sure you know where you want it before you stick it on because the tape is super strong). Easy assembly. I followed the directions and waited 24 hours before letting the cats get on it. The cover is super soft. Haven't washed it yet. I've got cat furniture all over the walls and my one cat found this thing and will not leave it. I only wish they made a smaller one to fit a different window.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Cat stays on sill now
customer_reviews.text: Bonnie was always falling off the window sill as she is wider than it is. This shelf is just right although I'm not sure it would work well for a very heavy cat because of the plastic brackets. I used the velcro because I didn't want to put holes in the shelf and the velcro grips real well. She can stretch out and is very comfortable on the foam padding. It's wider than I thought it would be which is a good thing. Very happy with it. Update - Velcro gave out so I ended up screwing it to the shelf. But Bonnie and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Great cat bed
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves it. Took a bit to get the velcro lined up and stuck well. Both cats lay in it most of the day.
customer_reviews.author: S.R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for even a Big Boned Cat ;-)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one for my bedroom because my 19lb boy kitty loves to watch the birds there. I was very unsure because of his size if this would work. I ordered industrial strength Velcro just in case. Turns out that I didn’t need that. This works purrfectly for him just the way it is. I did turn the pad cover around so the little backing is behind him. I’m going to order a second one for the living room window too. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendymichelle

customer_reviews.title: Problem with replacement covers
customer_reviews.text: On June 1, 2018, the manufacturer wrote this in the questions: Replacement covers are available directly through us. Please call our customer service department at 1-877-738-5188 for further information. I just called that number and they replacement covers are not available. They are trying to get approval to stock them. Why did they write that answer 2 months ago and now they don't have them? Cat loves the perch, but I have a Maine Coon mix who sheds lots of fur and will need replacments. Giving only 2 stars because I will have to replace the entire unit when I need a new cover.
customer_reviews.author: sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES looking out windows and was getting into trouble climbing onto surfaces he wasn't allowed for a better view. This window seat is perfect. I installed it by myself. I guess if there was anything I would suggest to improve it, it would be to find a way to better secure the pad to the shelf. He can claw it loose very easily - if there were some elastic straps that ran under the ledge, maybe he couldn't do that. All in all it's lovely for the cat and he's staying out of trouble and off of my kitchen table! I bought the version that does not heat up.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: This is a super shelf, my cats really like it. True, its plastic base is a bit weak for the weight of my kittens. I put another towel inside. Since the base is in the form of a mesh, in cats the legs are pressed through the fabric into these holes. I would advise the manufacturer to reduce the holes, to make them smaller than the cat's foot. Otherwise a great shelf. In the cold period, I put a blanket on top and there is no cold coming from the window, the cats definitely like it.
customer_reviews.author: Anzhelika Savenko

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get for heavy cat
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to like the product. At first my cats really enjoyed it but I guess my 15 pound boy was just too heavy, I think our 10 pound boy would have been able to use it okay but our heavier cat has it collapse while he was on top. I was excited to use this since we are renting I thought it would be easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn B.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good bed, but need extra Velcro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our cat for Easter. Yes, my cat received an Easter present including a basket. Don't judge. Anyway, it comes with Velcro to attach to you window ledge and the brackets just lean against your wall. My cat is 'medium' in size. I know their are ALOT of larger cats out there. I had extra duty Velcro that I put across the entire length INSTEAD of the two puny basic Velcro strips they provided. Once I did that, she enjoys this bed every day. Cover comes off to wash. Also easy to vacuum off with attachment while your cleaning as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Valentino

customer_reviews.title: Essentially, it works, but it could be better
customer_reviews.text: It is nice looking and my kitties love it. The things that I wish worked better are that the Velcro patches are completely useless. I didn’t want to use the screws because I’m renting this room for only a short period of time, but I had no choice since the Velcro doesn’t hold up. Also, I had to place padding between the wall and the plastic handles that hold the bed up because they rub up and down against the wall when a cat is stepping on the sill, or readjusting herself, or even just cleaning herself. I could hear the plastic scraping the wall while she was licking herself. Just not very good construction.
customer_reviews.author: KittyScrambles

customer_reviews.title: Kitty cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice window bed for the cats. All 4 of them love it. My husband had to do some adjusting as we don't have a window sill to attach to on the outside of the window. We keep the window open and use the inside sill. Unfortunately we will have to take it down during winter to be able to shut our window. I know our cats will miss it. They love watching outside and like it even more when the storm window is open. Very easy to vacuum and the cover is removable for washing.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This perch is really sturdy. Our Norwegian Forest Cat and Maine Coon are easily 20 lbs each, and they fit on it comfortably (not sure it could support both of them on it at once). I used both the velcro and the screws to lag it into place simply because 2 of our cats are expected to top out around 30 lbs. Plus, there's no way I could keep them off of it for 24 hrs after I adhered it. It's very secure. Seems durable and comfortable. Easy to clean. It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Not the sturdiest or prettiest, but it works
customer_reviews.text: The velcro they send with it wouldn't hold the weight of anything over a kitten. Another reviewer on this mentioned they used larger industrial velcro instead (you can buy it pretty much anywhere), so I tried that because I have to take it down every night to close my window. Worked like a charm, it's held up for over half a year now. It's definitely not a designer item, but it does the job and my little dog loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Bed on the Market
customer_reviews.text: This is hands-down the best cat bed on the market. It is secure, safe, and lasts. I've washed both the pad and covering numerous times without any problems. To date, I have bought 5. Two in my bedroom, two in my living room, and one to share. My oldest bed is 7 years old and looks "slightly used". One thing I did was to reverse the cushion so the roll was on the outside. This allows my cats to lay against it while looking outside. Otherwise, the roll blocks their view.
customer_reviews.author: stillwaters

customer_reviews.title: It does what it is meant to do
customer_reviews.text: I chose the one without the bolster so that my large cat can spread out on the bed. It is sturdy. The only problem I have is the cushioning is not thick enough for my preference I am sure it will be thick enough to satisfy all the other cats, but I wanted the cushion to be a bit thicker. I will be adding more cushion to it. I've only seen my cat use it once and I installed it 4 days ago but I hope that will change. I do wish it was 5 inches wider for my super big cat
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr purr purr
customer_reviews.text: We didn't use the suction cup option as we like the solid "screw the bloody thing into the window sill" method. Our chunky fluff monster, Bleu Cheese, loves his new cat bed. It's sturdy and good sized without taking up the entire window area. I imagine the heated version would be too much and he would just never move again. He rests, lounges, evades puppy, suns himself and stares at lizards on the garden trellis outside the window. Couldn't ask for more than this!
customer_reviews.author: BethLocke

customer_reviews.title: Great for napping in a sunny window!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves her new perch which was very easy to assemble. I appreciated that the screws are optional and just used the adhesive pads and support arms. Follow the directions and allow 24 hours for the adhesive to fully "stick" before use and you won't have problems. I also cleaned the windowsill and allowed it to dry fully before attaching the perch. My only dislike: the pad is quite thin. I added some additional memory foam under the cover to make it a nice resting spot. My cat loves it and gives it two paws up!
customer_reviews.author: Fila mom

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this kitty sill. Our cat loved it within a few minutes of our installing it. I coaxed her onto it with one of her toys. As I write this she is excitedly chattering at the birds feeding just outside the window. This product was easy to install. It comes with a velcro attachment option or a more-permanent screw attachment. I chose the latter because of some of the comments I read about the velcro not holding properly. So far, so good! I posted a pic. Our cat weighs 6 pounds, FYI.
customer_reviews.author: CDW

customer_reviews.title: Cat is happy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with the intention of installing it with the included screws. I also attached the velcro but the screws are holding the shelf in place. One cat is very happy with this shelf and it's their preferred daytime nap spot. The other cat is bigger and doesn't like the feeling of the shelf's give when he jumps onto it. The legs are not attached to the wall. The cover is easy to remove for cleaning. In conclusion, I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzytribble

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk (0 stars)
customer_reviews.text: this came without instructions first of all, Amazon was nice enough to email them to me but even with the instructions this product wouldn't stay on the windowsill even without a cat on it. it says to have at least a 2 inch window sill which i do. It states it can hold 20 plus pounds and it uses velcro that wouldnt even hold itself up Dont state that it is tooless assembly when in reality they want you to screw the thing to the windowcill. If I had know that I would have never purchased it. im not sure how this got so many good reviews. i would give it 0 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Your window still opens
customer_reviews.text: Kevin loves his throne. We plan to buy one for more windows in the house. He is the type cat that has to be in the same room as his humans so when we pass through the living room he jumps on it as to say Stay Here! He slept there, uninterrupted, during a series marathon. Kitty Kevin says ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ He can sit there with the screen in and smell the breeze and pretend he is out there saving the family from the evil birds and squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn T. Carr

customer_reviews.title: It somehow fits both my boys!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats that love the sunshine and therefore love the windowsill. This little perch fits them both when they’re being greedy with the space & offers a soft and sturdy spot to stretch out and nap for hours. It was really easy to assemble and the soft cover is removable/ washable. I have not yet washed it, but I think I would put it on “delicate” to not risk losing the elasticity that holds it onto the base. Great product in my opinion, and definitely a price I can agree with.
customer_reviews.author: Kary

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS! Cat is obsessed.
customer_reviews.text: Almost returned this until I put it up for a minute to see if cat would even like it... this is the holy grail! Just moved into a new (small) apartment and my cat has been unhappy to say the least! Constant meowing. He’s been sleeping on this thing as soon as I put it up for the past hour! He’s purring and absolutely loves it. Still not sure how I’m going to secure it as it’s being held up by my couch and doubt Velcro will hold his 15 pound chubby butt! Can’t use screws as I’m in an apartment but I will figure it out! So glad I did not return!
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: This was a game-changer!
customer_reviews.text: My two hefty male tiger cats would like to personally thank this company for opening up the outside world for them. On warm days/nights I leave the window open (with screen securely in place) and they particularly enjoy sniffing the early morning air. It’s big enough for both cats. Each boy weighs about 15 pounds and they can both sit comfortably together side-by-side and chitter at birds and squirrels. Installation was a breeze, but instead of drilling into the window frame I used Command strips to secure the part that rests on the frame and it’s holding up just fine. I don’t know why I waited so long before purchasing. Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Delilah D.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for a  cat
customer_reviews.text: This was too big for where I wanted to put it, but was very sturdy, well made and kitty would have loved it if I had kept it. Had to look for a smaller size for the bathroom window. Would recommend to anyone with a large window kitty wants to look out of
customer_reviews.author: Missy Larl

customer_reviews.title: How did my Mr. Meowgi ever go without this?
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best thing you could get for your cat if your cat loves to sit in the window like mine. Mr. Meowington fatso catso is quite a chonk and didn't fit very well on the window sill so I wanted to get him something with more depth and this is just perfect. He's a biggin' and still could fit another cat or two on this with him... Not that he'd ever allow that but IF he would. And its so soft and pushy. It's just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Bear 🐻

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made, does not fit all windows.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with all windows, initial description is a little misleading although I see now the minimum window ledge size listed in the details. The window ledge needs to be no less than an inch for this to be installed with either the screws or Velcro. The perch itself is cozy and well made but the installation did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable.
customer_reviews.text: We had this up a total of 2 days before it fell off, taking the paint from my windowsill with it. My kitty loved it! He jumped up and plopped down the second it was installed! 2 days later I heard a ruckus and went to see what happened. That's when I found it laying on the floor. Wish it would have worked better. I'm giving 3 stars because the 2nd one I purchased and installed at the same time is still fine...so I guess you have a 50/50 shot of it working for you! Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: DAB1110

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size!!
customer_reviews.text: This shelf is the perfect size for my small 8 pound cat. She has plenty of room to roll around and re-position if she needs to. When I first brought her home after adopting her, I noticed that she loved to get up on her hind legs and look out the window, and as soon as I installed this shelf she took to it right away. Definitely use the screws for installation. The Velcro was effective for the weight of my cat, but when I tried to reposition the shelf it stripped all the paint off of my windowsill. The screws will make the shelf more sturdy anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: My cat is now completely worthless.
customer_reviews.text: I have a feral rescue kitty who is 2. She’s paranoid but sweet and was on constant alert for intruders or maybe Death himself...I don’t know. She’s special but a great little bug killer. 2 days ago we installed this window seat. I think this thing broke my cat. After a bit of suspicious inspection she hopped on and hasn’t gotten up. She’s making bread on it and talking to squirrels but that’s about it. I had to kill a bug myself tonight. Positives: my cat loves it and it’s been 2 days since she’s done a ninja style sneak attack on me. Negatives: my cat has malfunctioned.
customer_reviews.author: WSH TX

customer_reviews.title: Wish I didn’t have to put holes in my window ledge
customer_reviews.text: Edit: I came home and it was on the floor. So never mind about the two sided velcro actually working. I guess I’m going to have to screw it down. Ugh. Still a pretty cool perch though. So I totally thought that there was no way a couple strips of two sided velcro would hold my 15lb cat up but surprisingly it actually works! It was super easy to assemble and I didn’t have to drill any holes in my window sill. My cat loves this thing! He jumps up onto it from the floor and from the bed and it’s totally held up! It’s super cute and looks great too! KittyCopilot on IG :)
customer_reviews.author: SamanthaOleander

customer_reviews.title: Both cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved into a small apartment in New York City with our two cats who are used to the freedom of being in- and outdoors. This was a big change for all of us and this Kitty Sill Deluxe has provided much welcomed and happy viewing pleasure for them. Opening the window a few inches so they can breathe in the air seems to be something they also enjoy. The size is great which I was surprised because one of our cats is pretty big. It’s so awesome that you can get it with an electric warming pad! Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: dcavery

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it and that's all that matters.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great perch and I bought it because you can use velcro to secure it to a window. I rent so I didn't want to use the screws. However, the velcro dosen't do a good job of holding my cat. I used several 3M command strips to secure the perch to the window. Also, I used these strips to secure the legs to the wall. You really have to push on the legs so that they snap, and I mean snap, into place. But they slide against the wall which is why I added command strips. My cat likes it and that's all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay M Dastrup

customer_reviews.title: Looks comfortable but its all plastic
customer_reviews.text: My cat is in the beginning stages of trusting it right now. I first used the velcro and it sucks. The other side of it will tilt down and pull the velcro apart slowly. The legs are made of plastic so the slide on my wall with the pressure. I screwed it down which I shouldn't have done since I rent but oh well they can deal with it later lol only get this If u buy heavy duty velcro to use or can screw it into place.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Baker

customer_reviews.title: Low quality.....picture does not represent its construction well.
customer_reviews.text: Good Idea for my indoor cats....12.... However the fleece cover is not very heavy and covers a thin cheep layer of foam rubber. The foam is not covered by fabric and is exposed to the plastic frame and loose elastic holds the cover over it. Designers obviously don't own cats or they would know the cover and the foam are goimg to need to be replaced soon. Just got it today so may need to edit review....I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: brick house

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it !
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge hit with my cats ! The cat pictured stays on this shelf all day ! This makes me happy bc before he constantly laid on my dresser , scratching it and shedding hair . I loved it so much I bough a second one for my other window . I have several cats and fosters . They all love bask g in the sun on these shelves . I agree with other reviews that mounts could be prettier but they can be painted . I could not comment on adhesive bc I chose to mount with screws .
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: If it can handle THIS load....
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20 pound Russian Blue that makes this bend when he jumps on it. So far, it hasn't broke which does speak of it's sturdiness. Mounting options aren't ideal and it is recommended by me to really secure this to the window sill. I didn't even try the velcro option because I don't want that sticky residue left behind and I didn't want to trust it. Drilling holes isn't ideal either but definitely the most secure.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Hoit

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions and installed the perch on my windowsill. The perch seemed fine for about a month and then in the middle of the night while my cat was laying on it it fell. The fall was violent and loud causing my cat to scream which woke up my wife and I. The adhesive was still attached to the window sill but had become detached from the perch itself. I’d suggest either purchasing a stronger adhesive or nailing the perch in, but do not trust the included method.
customer_reviews.author: rycette

customer_reviews.title: Get this for your cats!
customer_reviews.text: Wild Bill loves this bed....I got this months ago and he has spent about 80% of each day since lounging in it. He was feral as a kitten, and has a natural shyness to strangers. When he’s laying in the window bed he doesn’t care when people show up and knock on the door or tap on the window. He’s just way too relaxed to care. I kind of want a window bed now too! Also, he has plenty of room to stretch out -in- the bed but really likes belly rubs while dangling his feets off the edge. It’s his thing.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Mounting kit leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 13 lbs cats to have some outdoor viewing. The product is well made and provides a nice resting place for the boys. The down side is the Velcro strip that are provided if you do not want to use the mounting screws to drill into the window ledge, they are pretty much useless. The adhesive barely lasted a week before failing to hold. I ended up using the screws to secure the shelf to the window.
customer_reviews.author: Ster

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this perch!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Looks good in my dining room, blends with the decor. I like the bumper that goes around the bed and am pleased that it can all be laundered. I didn't install with the velcro as my window sill and been scratched up by one of my dogs and I didn't feel like it was a flat enough surface for the velcro to stay. It was very easy to install with the screws. You just need a drill. My cat loves this perch. I think he sleeps in it over night as I find him in it every morning. Overall, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: "No Tools" claim is false
customer_reviews.text: "Technically" it comes with velcro adhesive, but I wouldn't trust that to support a cat jumping up and down on, and also adhesive is likely to damage my window sill. I rent an apartment, so I can't put holes in my window sill or risk stripping the paint with adhesive. I'd hoped it was some sort of clamp or counter-balance system, but no, the back has to be secured in ways I can't as a renter, so I had to return this perch.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this window seat!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. One is 16 pounds and the other is 10 pounds. They both love this window seat. It is sturdy and looks great with the off-white cover. It's very attractive. I did add three screws and applied the seat into the window frame. From experience, the stick-on tape is not secure enough. The window seat would just loose its grip and fall to the floor. And mostly, it could cause injury to the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works, cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great, I did the screws and velcro, tightening the screws made the legs come up from the wall, so I added furniture let protectors and the legs stopped bouncing off the wall. Legs don't fit snug to my wall up top either, but it still works. Plastic. Wish there was a metal model. Color is bleak, cats are upside down on the headrest. Still, the concept is what my cats needed.
customer_reviews.author: Olive

customer_reviews.title: Kity sill.
customer_reviews.text: Still trying to mount this product. i have mounted it but am concerned that it is not sturdy enough. I am going so rig it up some way . I like the pearch and cover but afraid my cat will fall. Addition. Never could mount this perch in a stable manner. If you have a heavy cat be aware. I have not given up. Will have to construct my own support. if you have an extra wide window sill might be OK.
customer_reviews.author: Grannie Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December 2017 for my daughter's cat (11 lbs.). He loves being up in the highest vantage point that he can access. I had to strategically place items on my chest and dresser to keep him off of them. That was until I purchased the Kitty Sill seat. He loved it so much. I have a marble window sill and attached the seat with just the Velcro. It lasted about 15 months. I could tell when the Velcro was starting to come away from the sill and removed it so there was no accident with the cat. I have no complaints about the seat and I am going to buy another one for him.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa V

customer_reviews.title: It's fine. Nothing particularly special.
customer_reviews.text: The "legs" are plastic and look cheap (they are a tan/cream color). I spray painted them white, which helped some. The cover is a magnet for dust/hair -- or maybe the hair just shows more because it's white? The white shows every tiny thing! But it's easily washable, so it's not that big of a deal. It's fine. It's not particularly attractive, but it gets the job done and is sturdy if you screw it in properly.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love This
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely love these! We set them up very easily with the provided materials. We used the velcro as a buffer between the wall and the bracket, but used the screws for the window sill. Our 20 pound Maine Coon fits on the platform really well with extra space around him. It's sturdy for a large cat or two smaller cats. The fuzzy cover is soft and comfortable. They arrived earlier than I expected and were undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Burns

customer_reviews.title: Maine Coon & Calico approved
customer_reviews.text: I love this and so do my cats. We’ve had it for almost a month now. I’m not sure what the fuss is about the Velcro on this. It works like a charm. My gigantic kitten loves it and fits on it perfectly. The calico loves sleeping on it when the sun is out. It was so easy to put together. Well worth the money and keeps them from falling off the edge of the windowsill. I have pics but can’t find where to add them
customer_reviews.author: Padawanlearner

customer_reviews.title: Cat lady approved...meow
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! It took a few days (and some coaxing with treats) to get my cat to trust his new perch, but now he loves it. My boy is a spry but slightly chubby 11 year old, so I did end up putting a small storage ottoman off to the side to make it a shorter, easier jump for him to get onto/off of the perch. I flipped the bolster cushion thing around so he wouldn’t roll onto the ground if he got into a real deep sleep in a patch of sun and I most definitely secured it with screws into the windowsill. Happy cat, happy cat lady!
customer_reviews.author: clogan

customer_reviews.title: Cute and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Nice fabric but could use better padding. Very cheap egg crate foam. Was easy to install even though mine didn't include directions or screws. I put the cover on so the bumper was toward the outside instead of against the window so he can use it as a pillow. Not as large as I was hoping for but for now it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: MoJo4313

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought it years ago!
customer_reviews.text: At first we just used the Velcro but after two days it came tumbling down (thankfully Theo didn’t get scared from using it). This is now my cats new favorite spot. My only regret is not buying it sooner! It’s a great size so that he can lay on it and curl up without fear of rolling off. And it now stops him from trying to jump in the window and scratching up the wall (still to be repaired). Definitely highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: serwin03

customer_reviews.title: My cats give them 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: My cats are in love with this bench. We actually have three benches throughout the house, and the cats use them all. They are fairly durable (two cats can sit on them with no issue), and not too hard to clean since the cover comes off easily. My only issues with them are that sometimes the cat pulls the cover off when she rolls around (but that is with claw), and the padding underneath is not that thick, but my cats still don't seem to mind, so it may be a "cat mom problem."
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install with the provided screws and the cat loves it. The hairy little beast can't rip this thing off the window sill. If you can't drill three tiny holes into your wooden window sill, or if plastic anchors/screws going into your tiled sill creeps you out, there may be better options such as therapeutic help. Kidding aside, the velcro may not be a viable long-term solution. And if you look for another mounting scheme, remember that suction cups aren't your friend. So to recap, you need the ability to put peg "A" into slot "B" and use a small drill. Your cat(s) will love it.
customer_reviews.author: moozical

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this window perch! It was extremely easy to install (be sure to give the Velcro 24 hours like it says on the packaging). I don't have the screws installed because my cat is still pretty small, but if you aren't renting or you have a larger cat, I definitely thinks the screws are needed to ensure nothing falls off the sill. My roommate is thinking about buying one now too, for her cat. Other reviewers have mentioned that this lasts for years when properly installed, and I'm hoping that's what happens for me too!
customer_reviews.author: Allison B.

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This window seat was easy to assemble and put to use. My cats loved it immediately. But the tape that holds it to the window frame only lasted three months. Now it will not hold their weight (they are both average size, under 10lbs.), and only used it one at a time. It has dumped them twice, so now they won't use it any more. I could put a screw in the window frame, except that isn't desirable. So I've stopped using it. I will probably make my own that fastens securely into the wall because the cats really enjoyed it while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Tami C

product_meta.title: K&H PET PRODUCTS Kitty Sill
product_meta.description: Color:Tan Kitty Print| Style:Retail BoxWe listened to your feedback and innovated the popular Kitty Sill, into the K&H Deluxe Bolstered Kitty Sill today. The bolster is covered with a lush, soft poly/cotton kitty print and the inside is lined with soft velvety micro fleece. The bolster can easily zip off, and can be converted back into a plush kitty sill. Give your cat the advantage of looking out the window and basking in the sunshine, while having the security and coverage of a bolster.
feature_bullets: The Deluxe Kitty Sill gives your cat a sense of peace and tranquility. Your cat can bask in the sun while looking out of the window, and remain cozy and protected inside the bolster walls.

For any size cat: The Deluxe kitty Sill is for indoor use and accommodates even the largest of cats with its 14" x 24" size and sturdy design. This product can support up to 40 pounds. The legs are 3/4" Wide and 8" tall from window sill to the bottom of its legs.

No-sweat easy assembly: There are no tools required, making this kitty Sill practical for rental and small space living. For a more permanent solution, screws are included. It is the sturdiest window perch on the market! A standard 2" window sill is needed to properly perch.
Easy cleaning: Simply remove the cover and wash it on the gentle cycle with cold Water. Then line dry or use the no-heat cycle on your dryer.

Stylish design: The exquisite oval shaped design and leopard printed cover, is sure to bring some attention from visiting friends and family. The sleeping surface provides orthopedic support. The bolster can be easily removed -- simply zip off!
Warranty: This product has a 1-year limited warranty.
If you have questions, please contact us at 1-877-738-5188
